dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1951 IH: Strengthening Rural Cooperatives and Communities Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Riley of New York (for himself and Mr. Valadao) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to reauthorize rural cooperative development grants.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Rural Cooperatives and Communities Act.

section.header: Reauthorization of rural cooperative development grants
section.text: Section 310B(e) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1932(e)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The term cooperative development means activities including outreach, education, training, and technical assistance, to support the startup, expansion, or ongoing sustainability of new and existing cooperatives.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), by inserting , and award maximum points in scoring criteria to applicants that satisfy the requirements of paragraph (5)(F), before if the plan;
in paragraph (5), by striking subparagraph (D) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: commit to providing technical assistance and other services to socially vulnerable, underserved, or distressed communities;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6)(B), by striking If the Secretary determines it to be in the best interest of the program, the and inserting The;

in paragraph (10), by adding at the end the following: The Secretary shall analyze the data resulting from the research, and include the data and the analysis in the annual report submitted by the interagency working group under paragraph (12).;

in paragraph (12), by adding at the end the following: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this sentence and annually thereafter, the interagency working group shall submit to the Congress a report describing the activities carried out by the working group.; and
in paragraph (13), by striking 2014 through 2023 and inserting 2025 through 2029.
